bill_title: authorize an assessment of carbon sequestration potential in South Dakota, to make an appropriation therefor, and to declare an emergency.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to clarify the definition of value added agriculture. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 1-16G-27 be amended to read as follows: 1-16G-27. The Board of Economic Development shall administer the value added agriculture subfund , and make grants or loans from the value added agriculture subfund. The value added agriculture subfund shall be used to develop and promote value added agriculture in South Dakota including the initial or subsequent production, use, or processing of any form of agricultural commodity, product, or by-product in this state. Value added agriculture includes any process or practice that, by mechanical, chemical, or biological means, changes an agricultural product into another agricultural or nonagricultural product that has potential economic value. Such processes and practices include the feeding of commodities to animals. For projects which involve a separate agricultural research component, the Board of Economic Development shall consult with the research services of South Dakota State University. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to clarify the definition of value added agriculture. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 1-16G-27 be amended to read as follows: 1-16G-27. The Board of Economic Development shall administer the value added agriculture subfund , and make grants or loans from the value added agriculture subfund. The value added agriculture subfund shall be used to develop and promote value added agriculture in South Dakota including the initial or subsequent production, use, or processing of any form of agricultural commodity, product, or by-product in this state. Value added agriculture includes a process that, by mechanical, chemical, or biological means, changes an agricultural product into another agricultural or nonagricultural product that has economic value. For projects which involve a separate agricultural research component, the Board of Economic Development shall consult with the research services of South Dakota State University. BILL HISTORY 1/19/00 First read in House and referred to Agriculture and Natural Resources. H.J. 132 1/27/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/27/00 Agriculture and Natural Resources Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 12, NAYS 0. H.J. 264

bill_versions.bill_version: Senate Agriculture and Natural Resources Engrossed
bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize an assessment of carbon sequestration potential in South Dakota, to make an appropriation therefor, and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of two hundred fifty thousand dollars ($250,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Agriculture for the purpose of conducting a thorough assessment of carbon sequestration potential in the State of South Dakota. Section 2. The Department of Agriculture may contract for the conduct of the assessment authorized in section 1 of this Act with other state agencies, institutions of the South Dakota Board of Regents, or other private entities. Section 3. The assessment authorized in section 1 of this Act may use a combination of satellite data, digital elevation mapping data, climatological data, soil data, and other ecological data to assess agricultural lands in South Dakota. Section 4. The secretary of the Department of Agriculture shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 5. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2001, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21. Section 6. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the immediate preservation of the public peace, health, or safety, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval. BILL HISTORY 1/19/00 First read in House and referred to Agriculture and Natural Resources. H.J. 132 1/27/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/27/00 Agriculture and Natural Resources Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 12, NAYS 0. H.J. 264 1/31/00 House of Representatives Deferred to another day. H.J. 318 2/1/00 House of Representatives Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 57, NAYS 13.
